intro: Strychnos amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian strychnos, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It is notable for containing toxic alkaloids, including strychnine, which can be harmful to humans and animals. Despite its toxicity, it plays a role in the ecological systems of its native habitats.
